Title: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties.

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.

Author: George Orwell
Description: A novel about a totalitarian regime that uses surveillance to control its citizens.

Title: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

Title: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A novel about teenage rebellion and angst.

Title: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins in Middle-earth.

Title: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: A novel about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to kill the white whale, Moby Dick.

Title: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Description: A novel about the French invasion of Russia and the impact of the Napoleonic era on Tsarist society.

Title: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of a poor ex-student in St. Petersburg.

Title: The Brothers Karamazov
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A novel about the existential and moral struggles of a family in 19th-century Russia.

Title: Ulysses
Author: James Joyce
Description: A novel that chronicles the appointments and encounters of Leopold Bloom in Dublin in the course of an ordinary day.

Title: The Divine Comedy
Author: Dante Alighieri
Description: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Heaven.

Title: The Odyssey
Author: Homer
Description: An epic poem about the adventures of Odysseus as he returns home from the Trojan War.

Title: Don Quixote
Author: Miguel de Cervantes
Description: A novel about the adventures of a man who reads too many chivalric romances and decides to become a knight-errant.

Title: In Search of Lost Time
Author: Marcel Proust
Description: A novel about involuntary memory and the narrator's experiences growing up, participating in society, falling in love, and learning about art.

Title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
Description: A novel about the multi-generational story of the Buend√≠a family.

Title: The Sound and the Fury
Author: William Faulkner
Description: A novel about the decline of the Compson family, a once-prominent Southern family.

Title: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A novel about a future society that is superficially happy and highly controlled.

Title: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Bronte
Description: A novel about an orphaned girl who becomes a governess and falls in love with her employer.

Title: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Bronte
Description: A novel about the passionate and tumultuous relationship between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.
